metadata.Description: Biomass refers to organic matter, such as plants or plant-based materials, that can be used as a renewable energy source.

level 1.Description: Biomass implements energy generation methods that utilize organic materials to produce heat, electricity, or biofuels.
Biomass funds research and development initiatives to improve the efficiency and sustainability of biomass energy technologies.
Biomass focuses on renewable energy sources by utilizing organic materials to generate heat, electricity, or biofuels.
Biomass plays a role in the energy transition by providing a renewable alternative to fossil fuels for heat and electricity generation.
Biomass partners with the agricultural sector to obtain organic materials for biomass energy production.
Biomass contributes to climate change mitigation by reducing greenhouse gas emissions through the use of renewable energy sources.
Biomass monitors energy efficiency in biomass energy production processes to optimize resource utilization and minimize waste.
Biomass targets sustainable development goals by contributing to affordable and clean energy access for all.

level 2.Subject: energy and modernization
level 2.Description: Energy and modernization implements rigorous building standards that promote the use of energy-saving designs and materials.

level 2.Subject: energy and modernization
level 2.Description: Energy and modernization funds renewable energy projects to support the transition to clean and sustainable energy sources.

level 2.Subject: offshore renewable energy
level 2.Description: Offshore renewable energy implements building standards that promote the use of sustainable energy sources and technologies.

level 2.Subject: offshore renewable energy
level 2.Description: Offshore renewable energy funds research and development projects to advance the use of sustainable energy technologies.

level 2.Subject: just energy transition
level 2.Description: The just energy transition collaborates with local communities to ensure a fair and inclusive transition to sustainable energy.

level 2.Subject: just energy transition
level 2.Description: The just energy transition supports energy equity by promoting equal access to clean and affordable energy.

level 2.Subject: energy efficiency
level 2.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

level 2.Subject: energy efficiency
level 2.Description: Energy efficiency collaborates with industries to develop and implement energy-saving measures and technologies.

level 3.Subject: renewable energy agencies
level 3.Description: Renewable energy agencies employ experts in the field of renewable energy to drive innovation and promote the adoption of clean energy technologies.

level 3.Subject: energy markets
level 3.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

level 3.Subject: just energy transition
level 3.Description: The just energy transition employs a renewable energy workforce to support the transition to clean energy sources.

level 3.Subject: energy poverty indices
level 3.Description: Energy poverty indices implement energy access programs to provide affordable and reliable energy services to underserved communities.
